alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 8:55PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Near Lake Arthur affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding of low lying areas near the Pecos River caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Pecos River near Lake Arthur. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM MDT Friday, August 26 the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river crested near 13.4 feet around 3pm MDT Friday afternoon. The river will remain below action stage. However, low lying areas will remain flooded in the vicinity of the Pecos River. The river will continue slowly receding through Saturday and Sunday. - Action stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning around 715 AM MDT.
